text: Open file, read it, process, and write back - shortest method in Python
I want to do some basic filtering on a file.
Read it, do processing, write it back.
I'm not looking for "golfing", but want the simplest and most elegant method to achieve this.

code:
from __future__ import with_statement

filename = "..." # or sys.argv...

with open(filename) as f:
    new_txt = # ...some translation of f.read() 

open(filename, 'w').write(new_txt)

text: The with statement makes things shorter since I don't have to explicitly open and close the file.
